video:video.video:title: Volunteering with abused, destitute, disabled and orphaned children in India
video:video.video:description:
NEW EDIT: Filmed by Dan Davis, this video tells the story of children in India who have been abused, were destitute and abandoned. Unlike millions of children in India, these are some of the lucky ones who have found 'Snehalaya', a campus near Gwalior that means 'the home with love'. But the journey for these children does not end there. These vulnerable children still need 24 hour care and their life or death is determined by our carers and volunteers. Please help children in India and make the difference. Visit www.helpchildrenofindia.org for more information, volunteering opportunities, sponsor a child programme, fundraising, events etc. Thank you.
Email: mail (at) helpchildrenofindia.org
Credits: Film made by Dan Davis Volunteer - Gillian Ely Supervisor - Ravi Kumar

video:video.video:title: Rural Health Programmes - Gwalior Children's Charity
video:video.video:description: Part of our work extends beyond Snehalaya, our humanitarian Campus and into remote regions in Madhya Pradesh. This video briefly describes our rural health and education programmes and impact we have.
